alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Custer (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 3:57PM CDT until June 07 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Canadian River near Bridgeport affecting Canadian, Blaine, Caddo and Custer Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Canadian River near Bridgeport. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Flooding affects croplands... pastures... and oil wells near the river. Low-lying bottomlands near the river may be cut off from easy access by high water in side channels. Sand dredging operations are affected. Upstream points in southern Blaine County experience flooding before the areas near Bridgeport in northern Caddo County. Downstream points in southwestern Canadian County are affected hours later. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 13.9 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall to 12.3 feet Monday morning. It will rise to 12.4 feet Monday evening. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Action stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 400 AM CDT.
